name: market for assembly of generator and motor, auxilliaries and energy use, for mini CHP plant | assembly of generator and motor, auxilliaries and energy use, for mini CHP plant | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9656/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'assembly of generator and motor, auxilliaries and energy use, for mini CHP plant', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;This is delivering the  assembly of generator and motor, auxilliaries and energy use. The infrastructure is used in a mini combined heat and power (CHP) plant of approximately 2 kW. The process includes the most important materials used for production, energy and water needed for production. The motor is a water-cooled single-cylinder 4-stroke piston-gas internal combustion engine that weighs 30 kg. The generator is a 10 kW permanent magnet external rotor generator with central water cooling. For the assembly to the power unit of the mini CHP, a base frame (rolled section made of unalloyed steel), vibration dampers and the lubricating oil supply are required.

This activity starts with the service generation.


This activity ends with the service supplied to its consumers. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
